poem:
Morning Paper

I spread the newspaper like a bedsheet on the table,  
and there it is: a role offered the way a hand offers itself  
in the dark, then doesn't let go.  
Seventy-seven million—  
a number trying to weigh what can't be weighed.  
In the margin, my coffee ring  
becomes a small halo over the word power.
